thread.title: Re: SPOILER: There’s a big, beautiful door in the wall at the end of that 84 Lumber Super Bowl ad
thread.title_full: Re: SPOILER: There’s a big, beautiful door in the wall at the end of that 84 Lumber Super Bowl ad

author: topbond101
title: Re: SPOILER: There’s a big, beautiful door in the wall at the end of that 84 Lumber Super Bowl ad
text:
— Bill Bryan (@duckbil) February 6, 2017 
If you’re watching the Super Bowl, there just was an ad for 84 Lumber that’s making waves on Twitter. 
In the ad, a mother and daughter are seen walking through the desert, with the assumption being they’re illegal immigrants from Mexico heading to the U.S. The ad cuts off at 3o seconds into the journey, with a title card asking viewers to go to 84Lumber.com to “complete the journey.” 
Anyway, here’s the whole thing. Spoilers: The little girl is picking up trash to make an American flag and the family gets to come to America through a big, beautiful door in the wall. Check it out: Our complete Super Bowl story. See a mother & daughter’s symbolic journey toward becoming legal American citizens. https://t.co/AiI3MLrVd5 
— 84 Lumber Company (@84LumberNews) February 6, 2017 Trending SPOILER: There's a big, beautiful door in the wall at the end of that 84 Lumber Super Bowl ad 
And after paying all that money for the ad, their site is reportedly down. Good job, guys: Hilarious that 84Lumber paid $15MM for #SuperBowl commercial and the website they sent the world to doesn't work. #EpicFail #marketing 
— Leonardo Fassbender (@LennyFassbender) February 6, 2017 84 Lumber's site has crashed, but you can watch the conclusion of that immigration ad at https://t.co/yz2ZFZ5emA : https://t.co/8RtAQRKBTy pic.twitter.com/ThwdFf4eEF 
— Tim Nudd (@nudd) February 6, 2017 
***
